intro: Baphia polygalacea, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds used in traditional medicine and as a stimulant. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and cultural contexts.
